pull.title: doc: Change #bitcoin-dev IRC channel to #bitcoin-core-dev
pull.body: Mention new channel - split off Bitcoin Core project specific development discussion from the general Bitcoin development channel.

events.body:
ACK

On Wed, Sep 30, 2015 at 8:51 PM, paveljanik notifications@github.com
wrote:

> ACK
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/6741#issuecomment-144386658.
Would be nice to mention #bitcoin-dev for general bitcoin development?

> Would be nice to mention #bitcoin-dev for general bitcoin development?

Maybe, although that's really the domain for other resources (like the wiki, bitcoin.org, etc that refer to the entire network), not our project documentation.
Avoid prior mistakes:  Write one sentence to describe what is on-topic for the channel.

ACK.
Not sure if it needs a textline of what it on-/off topic (Bitcoin-core-dev sounds after a good topic).

events.message:
doc: Change #bitcoin-dev IRC channel to #bitcoin-core-dev

Split off Bitcoin Core project development discussion from the general
Bitcoin development channel.

events.body: OK, in `doc/README.md` under resources I've split out 'project-specific development' and 'general bitcoin development'. I'm not sure what is the place to go into more detail about what is on- and off topic, maybe a link in the topic of the channel itself.
Eh, when did this change? #bitcoin-dev has always been open to discussion of Bitcoin development, including Core, Electrum, etc...
